tool.name: umicount
tool.description: Count reads per gene from BAM using UMIs

param.name: method
param.label: Method to identify group of reads
param.help: UMIs with the same (or similar) codes can be grouped together. The simplest methods 'unique' and 'percentile' group identical UMIs, however 'cluster', 'adjacency', and 'directional' can group similar umis with edit distances less than some threshold. Unique: Reads group share the exact same UMI. Percentile: Reads group share the same UMI, and UMIs with counts 1% of the median counts for UMIs at the same position are ignored. Cluster: Identify clusters of connected UMIs (based on hamming distance threshold). Adjacency: Same as cluster, but considers only directly ajacent UMIs in the cluster. Directional: Identify cluster of connected UMIs based on hamming distance and umi.

param.name: gene_tag
param.label: Gene tag in bam
param.help: The gene information is encoded in the bam read tag.

param.name: per_cell
param.label: Group reads only if they have the same cell barcode.

param.name: per_contig
param.label: Deduplicate per contig (field 3 in BAM; RNAME)
param.help: All reads with the same contig will be considered to have the same alignment position. This is useful if you have aligned to a reference transcriptome with one transcript per gene.
